website_summaries.verdict: Good value and quality on this low-cost small box fan.
pros: This fan is easy to take with you
cons: The fan tends to have a lot of vibration

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware! - The fan blade is only 7 Inch diameter - Not 10 inch as advertised. Also, it's very loud - too loud to keep on - peace of mind comes when turned off... It's going in the garage to collect dust...
customer_reviews.author: Out West

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: If anybody has trouble sticking this fan in the window was it falling out take the top mounted switch off and the little nub will lock in the bottom of the window seal
customer_reviews.author: michael douglas

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  The perfect, simple fan for my windowsill.
customer_reviews.text: This fan is just what I needed. I wanted to have a fan narrow enough to sit securely on a small windowsill to bring in the cool night air without having to spend a lot of money on the double-blade window fans. I didn't need a timer, thermometer, remote, or any other bells and whistles. Just a couple of settings and an off switch. A simple fan, and it's perfect. It's about the size of a large dinner plate, the airflow is good, and the sound levels are reasonable. It has been running all night, every night for two weeks now, and I love it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Lots of wind for such a small fan
customer_reviews.text: I'm blown away (pun intended) by how powerful this small fan is. I bought it for my bathroom which doesn't have a lot of airflow. I have long curly hair that I straighten with a hair dryer so the bathroom heats up a TON even with the central a/c cranked up. I bought this fan to help keep the air moving more so I don't overheat while getting ready. Works like a charm. I haven't had any problems with it walking on the counter (but I do have it perched in a corner so it can't really move much). It gets used daily and hasn't failed me yet. Also, it's not all that loud considering how powerful it is.
customer_reviews.author: VWHITMORE

customer_reviews.title: Junk, Junk, Junk - lasted 32 days running 24/7
customer_reviews.text: JUNK! Lasted 32 days...not able to return to Amazon and not worth sending back to vendor... We have a rabbit in a hutch in our attached garage...during the summer he gets frozen bottles in the "den" portion of his cage where he spends his time and a fan located on the outside blowing air across the vent holes...the fan runs 24/7. Previous fan was same brand but different design and lasted 3 years...this fan, 32 days. Awful... Replaced with Vornado and it is much higher quality unit for 3* the price...throw $11 away or spend $30 for quality, your choice.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Morrison

customer_reviews.title: You might get one that doesn't have the clicking noise?
customer_reviews.text: I reduced the rating because the fan makes a very loud and very annoying "clicking" noise. Hard to describe noises, but it changes with the speed of the fan. It is less irritating at high speed as the fan is much noisier at that speed which masks the clicking noise somewhat. It may be a bearing noise, if the motor even has a bearing, but it's definitely coming from the motor. I kept the fan for use in the garage, where the noise doesn't bother as much.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice fan and for it's size does blows out a good amount of air. I live in an apartment where they control the heat and it be so hot in my bedroom at night and this fan is perfect. It does make noise which doesn't bother me at all. I'm thinking about getting a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fan to take with me on my trip to Guatemala where we were without air conditioning for two weeks. One of my better decisions for the trip. It was lightweight and not too bulky, perfect for our packing limitations. We left it running all night every night and whenever we were home in the daytime. It wasn’t too noisy at all and gave a consistent air flow that was perfect. The only feature it didn’t have that we’d have liked was some way to angle up and down. We ended up stacking suitcases on top of a chair and balancing the fan to get it where we’d like and for the price, I think that’s okay.
customer_reviews.author: amalco2

customer_reviews.title: Trash, DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it so far , it's a decent fan , SORRY BUT IT DIDNT LAST LONG. NOT EVEN A MONTH AND BARLEY WORKS , 4-17-19 up days , fan turns on , stays on low no matter on setting , after about an hour it go's to high , TRASH
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a window fan
customer_reviews.text: Bought this smaller fan to fit into a high sliding window in our bedroom to pull in cold air. Other window fans were too big to fit in the window casing. Fits perfectly between the screen and the blinds and pulls in a decent amount of cool air at night, keeping the room cool. Noise isn't bad, serves as white noise while sleeping. Would recommend for smaller windows for ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: cori

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I gave it give stars because it's a fan and does what it's supposed to and throws a decent amount of air. If I rated it for the purpose I bought it I'd have to say only 3 stars. I needed something to put in window to pull out cigarette smoke and it's not powerful enough for winter wind. Under normal use it's excellent for sleeping with.
customer_reviews.author: emmalea50

customer_reviews.title: Good little fan, perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: Good fan, and is the perfect size to fit in the windowsill of my basement window. Two settings, 1 is pretty light and quiet, 2 has some pretty good power and is also not too loud. Good fan for the size and price. Seems to be durable so far, as I've dropped it a couple of times and it's still running.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not very powerful, weird rattle
customer_reviews.text: Meh... I've had much better fans for the same price. I will say that it's not very loud, but that's because the High setting is other fans' lowest setting. It really doesn't circulate air very well. I'm pretty disappointed in this Holmes product. It also makes a weird rattling sound on the low setting.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe

customer_reviews.title: Meets our needs
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our little camping/utility trailer, which does not have AC. We bungee cord mount it to one of the small side windows - to both blow the hot air out or cool air in. We haven't slept with it on, but I think I could handle the light noise it produces. It meets our small-space needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: A good little fan for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have "short" windows, and the regular 20x20" box fans are way too big. This smaller size fan is excellent for that. When operating well, these fans are great - decent power for the size (can definitely cool a room down if the outside air is cooler), fairly quiet, good range of speeds. They do wear out somewhat quickly, though - usually getting more noisy over time, and eventually dying completely (I assume the motor gives out). I'd say each fan lasts through a couple years of use in the spring and fall. However, given the price and the limited selection of this size, I'm willing to replace them every couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Thorkildsen

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little box fan. It puts out a great amount of air for such a small fan. I love how light it is yet it's stable. I have a 200 square foot bedroom and wanted something that would blow directly on me while I sleep to keep me cool. It's on the lowest setting 5 feet from me and in 90 degree weather I haven't needed to even turn it up to high. It definitely has the sound of a normal fan so it's not silent but for me it's more quiet then the floor fan I had previously. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable for long term use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this fan for going on three years now. I’ve left it running on high for weeks at a time during the summer months... I’ve left it in the window while it rains and snows... I’ve left it running and left for vacations... and it still runs just as well as the day I got it. Fairly loud, but it’s a low white noise, not squeaky or anything. Lightweight and generally portable for its size. If you’re looking for fashion, this isn’t it—it’s boxy and not exactly elegant but it does the job admirably. I would probably prefer if it came in black because the white will get dingy and stained over time.
customer_reviews.author: Holden Compton

customer_reviews.title: Great little exhaust fan
customer_reviews.text: Our bathroom has 2 vent fans but the window is so teeny. This fan sits great on the sill and when we shower we blow the air directly out through the screen. When it is cooler outside we open the window and flip it around and suck the cooler air in. To me this fan works much better than our bathroom vent fans.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Di Pietro

customer_reviews.title: this is an ok fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a similar Duracraft fan that broke, I use it in a window. This fan has barely any power compared to my old fan, even on high it doesn't move much air.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This fits perfect in our small bathroom window. We have no exhaust fan and it works great pointing in or out of the window. Is a bit noisy but for a bathroom it really doesn’t matter to us. Works great and has two levels.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, but very cheaply made.  Thin plastic.
customer_reviews.text: This fan works well, and is quiet, but it looks very cheap, thin plastic. but I guess you get what you pay for. Hopefully it will last awhile. as I said, for the money it's a good fan, if you don't mind the looks.
customer_reviews.author: LILLIE DIANE BLEVINS

customer_reviews.title: Works as a window fan
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got this installed as a window fan on a daily timer in my basement where the windows are small and it works perfectly and hasn’t broken well after a years use every day
customer_reviews.author: Franky Bob

customer_reviews.title: very loud
customer_reviews.text: I would give this one star, but i have to admit that it puts out a lot of air for such a small fan. But contrary to other reviews i found it to be quite loud - it sounds like you are next to the airport runway. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: McMoo

customer_reviews.title: Died after a few months of intermittent use
customer_reviews.text: Ok - it's cheap, but I expected it to work longer than the few months that it did - especially since it was only used intermittently in the summer. One day it decided not to work. Can not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Reader

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of Money.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these little fans at first. They worked wonderfully for about a month and then one night the fan speeded up so much that it sounded like an airplane engine. There was absolutely no air flow when that happened and it was the same whether it was on high or low speed. I turned it off, waited a few minutes, and turned it back on. It was normal again. But a few minutes later, the same thing happened. No air flow at all and very, very loud. Our electricity is not wonky at all and this happened to BOTH fans. I ended up throwing them out. Holmes is usually a good product, but these fans were disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain Great fan
customer_reviews.text: I live on a noisy Farm Market road and I keep this fab going 24/7. It is great. I also drop it in a bag and take it with me when I travel to use at the hotels to block out noise. It is light, compact, and does a great job at providing constant noise so I can sleep.
customer_reviews.author: PastorLamb

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This fan has been a lifesaver. I purchased this for my missions trips. I sleep very hot and have a hard time getting comfortable. This fan is not overly loud and provides me enough airflow in order to sleep more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F.

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I ordered this fan
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I ordered this fan, I needed a small fan for my kitchen window to help keep it cool while I'm cooking. This fan is perfect, very quiet yet powerful, doesn't vibrate or run rough, and moves the air very efficiently, I definitely recommend this fan, I'm a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Hawkes

customer_reviews.title: Nice breeze, not strong
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use this in the window to blow out cigarette smoke. Fit in window nicely, but isn't strong enough. Now using it in the bedroom to bring in more of a breeze. Works well for mild breeze. Quiet and consistent air flow. Good for white noise. Plastic doesn't seem very sturdy, but good enough for the price. Not recommended if you need a very strong fan. Good packaging, arrived as expected via Prime
customer_reviews.author: jenanaw

customer_reviews.title: Compact and works for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: It's small and will cool off a small remote area. I suggest having it near you like on a desk or table top, or a night stand next to you when sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is great for small area's and it produces a good wind current. It is easy to move from room to room and doesn't take up to much space.
customer_reviews.author: koalabear4me

customer_reviews.title: Died after just 8 months
customer_reviews.text: It was not a high powered fan, but adequate. However, it just died eight months after I bought it. It HAD gotten a bit of rain spray 3 or 4 days before, but I've had that happen with a lot of plastic fans before and they continue running for months or more.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great little fan, right up until it died, maybe a month after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! I opened my order history to return this item and the return window just expired. This little fan was doing a great job right up until now. My husband expressed concern this week due to a noise it had been making, as if power were surging through it and then slacking, over & over. I tried it again on a different setting and that is when it stopped responding altogether. It is a great size and not expensive, but I will not be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Fits my basement window perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet I put it in my basement window and let it run. I use the fan as an exhaust out no noise on high and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Rbud

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy, this is exactly what I wanted. it's very simple with two setting (high/low). I put it in my kitchen window when I need to air out the kitchen, so I didn't need anything fancy. it's thin enough to fit on the window sill.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cruz

customer_reviews.title: If you're planning on using this in your bedroom don't run it on high you'll never get to sleep
customer_reviews.text: The old saying they don't make them like they used to I have an old 8in metal blade fan that'll blow this thing backwards
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these at once for my sons room and my daughters room. One is perfect, but the other seems like it has been dropped at some point. It rattles so loudly and shakes so much that it will walk itself off whatever surface it is on unless I brace it in place. They arrived in the same package so it must have been pre-shipping otherwise its likely both would have suffered the same fate. So, a great fan, just maybe don't drop it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: noisy fan
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewer said their fan was quiet, can't say the same for mine. On high this fan is just to loud for me, on the low setting it is tolerable but still not all that quiet. I bought for $13 so I will live with the noise.
customer_reviews.author: eagle1

customer_reviews.title: unbalanced, causes grinding noise
customer_reviews.text: This fan is terrible. Once it is on for a while it becomes unbalanced and you can hear it start clicking loudly which also causes it to be less efficient. I keep having to turn it off and on. Also it is extremely loud even when it is working as expected, I need to turn it off during conference calls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am not a fan of this fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan for a basement window for an exhaust. I am not pleased with its performance. Out of the box I could tell the blades were not balanced well as soon as I fired it up. It rattles and shakes on both speeds. My pet peeve with fans is when they make rattling noises... it is like fingers on a chalk board to me. I would not recommend this fan based on my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ESTEE

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the money...
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty inexpensive fan, which works like a fan. That's basically all I can say. Nothing fancy, and the high setting won't blow your house over, but it moves air pretty alright.
customer_reviews.author: TINA

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I had hoped, but it does work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put in a window to occasionally vent a room. I think I'll need something bigger as it doesn't really move a lot of air. It does however create a nice gentle breeze, so using it as a desk fan or something will probably be ok. Just not a lot of CFM. Also vibrated a fair amount, had a tendency to walk around on the table despite the rubber feet on the bottom. Probably could use some blade balancing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great fan.
customer_reviews.text: I put this fan in a window and it did a great job this year. It helped keep my cooling bill down.
customer_reviews.author: Freaky Fredy57

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I like it....thought it didn't blow enough air when I first started using it...but it has proven it was worth the purchase. Loud too much as some of the reviewers noted. Turn it off when I am sitting but on it goes when I am busy and moving around a lot. Put it in the bathroom to help dry hand washing and it does good. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Daleen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good fan
customer_reviews.text: Good fan. It works as described. Good price. Correct size for basement window sill. I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Buzzard II

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant design!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cool a stereo receiver that has a tendency to over heat and it works brilliantly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Braga

customer_reviews.title: Great for small places.
customer_reviews.text: I like in an apartment that has no air conditioning in the kitchen. Plus the window is small, same as my bathroom. This fan is perfect. Does it make noise, yes but the benefits are great. It is a pleasure to cook in my kitchen again. I would recommend this fan for small windows.
customer_reviews.author: Mimsy

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have barely used the fan within the last 3 months and it is already broken. It does not turn on when plugged in. I gave it 2 stars because it was efficient when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Big Breeze in a Little Package
customer_reviews.text: Fits well on a short ledge and serious breeze for such a little fan.
customer_reviews.author: M. Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This fan starting buzzing within minutes after I turned it on. So I put in on a softer surface just to be sure it wasn't vibrating. Nope. I have used Holmes fans for years, but sadly they have turned their back on quality. Will purchase this brand no more...
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great breeze!
customer_reviews.text: This little fan can put out the air!! Great to travel with!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace fan we use in bedroom to mask outside noises at night. Fan a little noisy compared to old fan but excellent choice for it's intended purpose. I recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Old and Still Kicking

customer_reviews.title: needs a slower speed
customer_reviews.text: nice unit, but I wish it also had a 3rd speed, a bit lower.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fan
customer_reviews.text: Fits comfortably in my window perfect soze to move from room to room
customer_reviews.author: Ayisha Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Really good airflow
customer_reviews.text: Fan puts out a nice flow of air. Only complaint is it is not as quiet as I would like it. It's not noisy at all but I wanted a very quiet one.
customer_reviews.author: Shason Rowilmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this fan. Fits in bedroom window perfect. Nice compact fan to draw air in. Not real quite but not too loud either
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great fan, makes a good amount of white noise to help you fall asleep
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Brinson

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this small fan March 22nd. Its may 21 and it already is not running correctly. Dont waste your money. Very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: angelhair

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for rooms where you don't want a fan ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fan for rooms where you don't want a fan sitting on the floor. Our bedroom is air conditioned but needs a little air flow to keep it really cool. I sat this on a,piece of furniture and it is great. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: marian collier

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully it'll last at least a year.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I expected for $20, but it's even less sturdy than I was thinking it would be. Feels flimsy, and doesn't move a lot of air. The highest fan speed just okay.
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: I returned it but that’s because I wanted a fan that was loud. I bought it for travel to have Boise while sleeping. This fan was very quiet. So if you’re looking for a lightweight quiet fan, it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Newby

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little fan for my art studio. It works fine, right out of the box. It's quiet and puts out enough juice to keep the air moving through my very small studio. It would make a good personal fan for bed or desk. It's small enough to sit on my window sill.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: perfect size & lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small fan to occasionally put into a window. This is perfect to use on those days when it's not hot enough for the a/c.
customer_reviews.author: MARY B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for price
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly strong for a small fan. My only quibble is that it has both High and Low speeds, but the Low is more like a Medium speed. It's not truly a low-speed fan. Fits well on windowsill and is reasonably quiet. All plastic construction these days, these are cheap throw-aways but will usually give you 2-3 years of life.
customer_reviews.author: JKomTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Powerful & great white noise
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We use this when we travel and it is wonderful to have on cruises!! Puts out a lot of air and perfect white noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but sort of loud
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of circulating air and is powerful for such a small and lightweight fan. My only complaint is that it is relatively loud, especially compared to the other window fans I have (Holmes dual blade window fans).
customer_reviews.author: Christina C

customer_reviews.title: Solid, quality fan
customer_reviews.text: I tend to sleep with a small box-type fan on my bedside stand, but the usual "el cheapo" models I'd get at places like Wal-Mart seemed to wear out rather quickly. I decided this time around to get something a step or two up from the norm. Thus far I'm happy with my purchase: it's a solid, well-built fan without that cheap plastic finish I'd (unfortunately) grown accustomed to, and it delivers a stable breeze without being very noisy at all. I'm looking forward to a long, trouble-free life for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Dyson

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with the quality of product, cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Sindh

customer_reviews.title: great fan for $14 but price went up to $41- no way I'll pay that
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome fan! Quiet and full force blowing fan. Not like some of the cheap ones. I took it on a trip in a hotel because I need air movement. I was going to buy another one! My only concern is how did this item go from $14 to $41??? I won't buy at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Charles

customer_reviews.title: has only two speeds
customer_reviews.text: I failed to realize that it had only two speeds,but was worth keeping
customer_reviews.author: rose 3

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful fan, for its size. Really surprised me how good it is.
customer_reviews.author: xtra

customer_reviews.title: Small but very loud.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to place in our window on cooler nights. It's pretty loud, but not as strong as we were hoping. Overall, it's compact and slim though, so it's really just the fact that the noise it puts out doesn't really match its power. We ended up not really using it because it was so loud.
customer_reviews.author: Salina Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: It gets foul, so I disassemble it and clean it every ...
customer_reviews.text: Have this wedged in a small bathroom window for ventilation. It gets foul, so I disassemble it and clean it every 6 months. 6 philips head screws. Almost 2 years going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Colt American

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a small fan to put in a bathroom window during renovations to pull construction dust out the window. Fan blades themselves are smaller than I expected and the highest speed is not very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Breen

customer_reviews.title: Good little fan. Just not slim enough.
customer_reviews.text: Dimensions not as described. About 5.25 inches deep, not four inches, including cord clearance. Does not fit my space, as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: A Skinny Jay Review!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little box fan is exactly as advertised. Shiny white plastic two fan speeds are quiet, not silent, but quiet I use this in front of the window of a small second bathroom in my apartment that does not have a built in air circulator. It keeps the bathroom fresh and dry. I am very satisfied with it for the price
customer_reviews.author: Skinny Jay

customer_reviews.title: 2 fans, both came broken.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. First one came in with a broken knob. They sent a replacement... 2nd one, the knob immediately broke. I would say this is a piece of junk. Buy something else, it’s not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelene Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: It also seems pretty durable. We have two other Holmes fans that ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this fan in the window to push hot air out of a small window at night. It works well and is surprisingly powerful for the size. It also seems pretty durable. We have two other Holmes fans that have endured heavy use and small children for eight years and counting. I expect similar results from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Mae

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: We wanted this fan to dry a storage area and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: gail jewell

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last more than a year
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t last more than a year and the noise became horrendous!
customer_reviews.author: viley

customer_reviews.title: Usable, limited applications. Low power, OK for tent.
customer_reviews.text: Hardly any blowing power seems to have decreased since purchase. Has 2 speeds. Lo/HI. Only using for circulation, thankfully, as she doesn't put out much OOMPH. but she's great for airating planter.
customer_reviews.author: J "Whale" Manasco

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Airplane Engine Throttling Up Down
customer_reviews.text: This was crap! Owned a Holmes before- it was great. This one's rpm varied continuously like an airplane engine being throttled up and down. Try sleeping with that! Instead of falling to sleep you find yourself concentrating on only the fan, wondering if it's going to seize up in the middle of the night and burn your house down around you!! Great fun. Amazon was excellent at refunding.
customer_reviews.author: p47_pd

customer_reviews.title: powerful for size
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a vent fan and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ambiant noise but not for what a fan does.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for sleeping noise, which its great, Air flow is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Good fan but vibrations make it "walk" on some surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Its a great personal fan. Does not rotate but does have variable speeds. I got it for the bathroom that gets hot from steam and/or blow drying hair. Works great for that but I have to sit it on a hand towel or it vibrates so that eventually it "walks" off the counter. That's the only reason I didn't give a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: KYDeb

customer_reviews.title: The low speed is pretty quiet, which is what I hoped for when ...
customer_reviews.text: The low speed is pretty quiet, which is what I hoped for when used at night. The blades I think are a bit too small and could have been made bigger considering the size of the housing unit.
customer_reviews.author: David Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Great window fan
customer_reviews.text: I have very thin window sills and this works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Tobyluv

customer_reviews.title: Great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Produces just the right amount of air flow. Fits nicely on window sill unlike the 20" window fans. I'm well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Claymore

customer_reviews.title: Ham Radio Operator
customer_reviews.text: This little box fan exceeded my expectations. It has 2 speeds, and it is much more quiet than my other 10 inch box fan. It moves alot of air for it's size. I like it so well that I plan on ordering another one soon. It is well built compared to my other box fan. I like it and am very satisfied with it. I would say if you are looking for a small fan, buy one of these. I don't think you would be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Ham Radio Operator

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is perfect for small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a tiny house so it works perfect for the space.
customer_reviews.author: Aymeth Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great and such a GREAT PRICE !
customer_reviews.text: VERY hard to find a FAN in DECEMBER and Amazon has it. Great fan. A++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Hoarder

customer_reviews.title: Strong Little Fan
customer_reviews.text: Nice fan. But be aware, it has two speeds and both push out quite a breeze. I had it right next to my chair (about 2 feet away) and its to strong for my comfort. But if you have a small space you really want to air out, this might be the ideal fan.
customer_reviews.author: BonnieBBoy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fans, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: We received the two fans. One does not blow air forward at all despite the fan blades turning. The other will blow air forward on the low setting but not on the high setting. These are incredibly cheap, poorly designed fans. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in WA

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the noise but it’s so quiet you don’t hear it at all.
customer_reviews.author: B.Koster

customer_reviews.title: Cute but weak
customer_reviews.text: Fits in a small window very well but doesn’t move much air?
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gernaat

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I got it to place by the window for extra exhaust while cooking. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe D

customer_reviews.title: A month wait for this garbage? Wow
customer_reviews.text: It took a month for this piece of garbage to get here. After waiting a whole month... this thing barely blows at all. Well, it blows... just not air. Garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan

customer_reviews.title: Great little fan
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, we use it when sleeping and it's been running flawlessly since we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: David Stiles

customer_reviews.title: NOT VERY QUIET
customer_reviews.text: Not very quiet. I got this for a small window mainly to draw hot air out, ok but I didnt have much choice, window is 14" smallest box fan is 16"
customer_reviews.author: Zane Icadia

customer_reviews.title: Poor on air flow
customer_reviews.text: For price shouldn’t expect much and that’s exactly what get have in small bedroom barley feel a breeze times have to check make sure on comes in handy in kitchen window when cooking no fan so put in facing out blow smoke out🙂
customer_reviews.author: Bob

product_meta.title: Holmes 10-inch Personal Size Box Fan, HABF120W
product_meta.description: Keep small rooms cool during hot, humid summer months with the Holmes Personal Box Fan. Featuring two speed settings, this lightweight and portable personal fan delivers quiet and efficient operation. The slim design takes up minimal space, making this square fan a great choice for use on desks or bedside tables. This box fan has a 10-inch blade span and measures approximately 10 by 5 by 2 inches.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars872 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
